5.post_text:
Goodbye humdrum, hello life — the all-new BMW 1 Series. It’s all down to its athletic design, inspiring dynamism and high efficiency. Its diesel-powered engine is also capable of achieving a range of 1,220km at full capacity.

Check out the all-new BMW 1 Series at our showroom.

6.post_text:
Say hello to the future! The #BMWi3 is not only emission-free, but also offers an incomparable and near-silent driving experience.

Have you spotted this iconic all-electric BMW i3 on the road?

comments.message: Not even once. I must be concentrating & watching my speed after demerit for speeding. 😢

its a wonderful car... I had the pleasure of having it for a weekend.. managed to find a place to put the charger should I but it. Salesperson was not keen on discussing ownership options.. am still keen.. let me know when we can talk ...no sales person please...management only
Only once ba.
Very nice car but over 200k leh... also why to recharge???
Yes, any discount or goodies throw to attach new buyer ?
Nice leh it be good if we have i3 taxis
Too many on the road already....
@zakaria I think you have a serious problem with bmw , maybe the sales manager you met is not doing his/her job well but not bmw .

Yes.. Agree. Had it since 2011. No problems.
Again.. this is a one man's meat, another man's poison scenario.
Cheers all and happy motoring.

Not anymore. Correct me if I'm wrong but there is now only ONE 6 pot engine in the entire range of 3s (leaving aside the M3) and the X1 is now driven by the front wheels. How do they a driver's car make?

Fully agree that PML needs to drastically improve their technical skill-sets and diagnostic tools to keep up with the newer cars.  I have been stranded not once, not twice..but 3 times in 3 weeks!! for a faulty component that is draining the battery flat over 3 days.  The troubleshooting seems like doing the best guess and see what happens.  Joy is not solely about driving, if it keeps breaking down, what joy is there when one keeps sending a new car back to the same PML workshop over and over again? Just shocked by the competency level and various things that are claimed to have failed for a new car.  I am really worried what else will happen down the road... more late night chit-chats with BMW emergency recovery technicians? First beamer after many various cars.... terrible experience... ever!
Yes...Paul had a good conversation with me but it's too late...more over he can't help me ...useless ...speechless...helpless...but I still love my car...tks

Hi Zakaria Alhafiz Md Shariff, thank you for taking the time to share your concern with us, we are very sorry to hear about the trouble you have encountered. 
Your query has been directed to the concerned in Performance Motors and someone will be in touch with you soon. We thank you for your patience.

Yes I call him at least 7 x ..at least he Peter or tony must call n console me as a sales manager or to explain the problem of mycar...but they don't care at all by not returning my call and make their sales technical personnel keep blaming the owner...my car is only 3 year old car.....BMW 523i

This is the biggest BS!  I drove 323i and then 523i for 10 years and always serviced it at Performance - according to their service schedule. The last car stalled in the middle of a traffic junction due to the engine been stuck with hardened motor oil. That car was only 4-5 years' old. When I got it towed back for checks, I was told that they found hardened oil patches inside the engine compartment and even told me that this was the result of not changing my lube oil. What??? When I asked for my record to show how I had compiled with their service routines and paid for everything that they asked me to, the records were not even input (updated).  The cost of the repair was  over 10K with no assurance that he problem will be totally eradicated.  This case was documented with a copy to Performance Alexandra and a copy to BMW Germany.  I sold the car and bought a Lexus GS300 when the COE was 60K+; never ever to buy another BMW and sharing this unfortunate episode to anyone who wishes to know. I have driven my Lexus for over 4 years now and NEVER an hour of problem or down-time. Mine may well be just bad luck. My 1st BMW suffered gear problems when it was only 5 years' old and I traded it for the 523i. At that time, I was luckier as the COE was low.

Bull Shit ...!!! BMW Car I think made in China ..I agreed super ...rrrrproblematttiicc lousy car and their do nothing sales manager not doing performance job...so don't call performance motor ok call sueey motor pls share
This is what you call ParentCompany PML selling me battery for $780 ....outside shop $280 for the same battery....
Powerrrr
I still think it is
Agree...
Best
Definitely a drivers car, also, a mechanics rice bowl. 😅
The look 'yes'. But Super problematics car! Seems to hve problem every month!!

11.post_text:
The 10 million mark has been reached! The 10 millionth BMW 3 Series Sedan has rolled off the production lines at BMW Group Plant Munich. The landmark vehicle is the latest milestone in the 40-year success story of the BMW 3 Series.

Did you know that the BMW Group Plant Munich currently produces 1,000 cars a day, half of them BMW 3 Series?

12.post_text:
Thank you everyone for celebrating the launch of the all-new BMW 1 Series with us. 

Start practising your German, Derrick Yeo! You are heading to Munich and that exclusive BMW Plant Tour with a pair of return air tickets from us! Kindly private message us your full name, NRIC, and contact details within 48 hours to claim your prizes. 

And sharing the joy further, the winner for the BMW 1 Series Weekend Experience will be contacted by phone. 

With upgrades from its exterior to its interior, the all-new BMW 1 Series is the only rear-wheel drive hatchback in its class. Its diesel-powered engine is also capable of achieving a range of 1,220km at full capacity. Experience sheer driving pleasure that’s truly worth sharing at 303 Alexandra Road. #L1feworthsharing

This is the biggest BS!  I drove 323i and then 523i for 10 years and always serviced it at Performance - according to their service schedule. The last car stalled in the middle of a traffic junction due to the engine been stuck with hardened motor oil. That car was only 4-5 years' old. When I got it towed back for checks, I was told that they found hardened oil patches inside the engine compartment and even told me that this was the result of not changing my lube oil. What??? When I asked for my record to show how I had compiled with their service routines and paid for everything that they asked me to, the records were not even input (updated).  The cost of the repair was  over 10K with no assurance that he problem will be totally eradicated.  This case was documented with a copy to Performance Alexandra and a copy to BMW Germany.  I sold the car and bought a Lexus GS300 when the COE was 60K+; never ever to buy another BMW and sharing this unfortunate episode to anyone who wishes to know. I have driven my Lexus for over 4 years now and NEVER an hour of problem or down-time. Mine may well be just bad luck. My 1st BMW suffered gear problems when it was only 5 years' old and I traded it for the 523i. At that time, I was luckier as the COE was low.
This is PML at Tanjong Rhu?
It's this for any BMW 2 Series?
is there like a price list?

I am wondering why PML even bother to put such advertisments....total crap and total BULL SHIT my ex 730li failed within 4 yrs and with a 64k mileage got rid of it and got another conti brand... BMW cars  Bullshit they dont build like before

Hi PML......! I would like to lodge a complaint against your sales Managers  Paul Wee from BMW East Coast. I first sent my car there to check on a stalled engine as I was driving. To my disappointment, upon inspection, they accused me of not being prompt in my servicing of the car. This is absolute nonsense as I have never missed any service apart from a slight delay for 2 of them as far as I can recall. When I was informed that the problem is due to sludge that was formed in the engine oil compartment, I can't help but ponder. Is this a China-made car?! Come on, this is BMW! I know the quality of the car and it comes with a hefty price too! When the technician quoted me the cost of repair to rectify the engine was $11000, I tried to call Paul but what was appalling was that he did not reply or even made the slightest effort to consult me on this! I then wanted to look for an independent BMW workshop to ask for a 2nd opinion. However, the reassembly of the parts without rectifying the problem cost me more than $2000 ...(just assemble back)  After getting a quote of $7000 from the another workshop for the repair, I tried to suggest to the technical personnel about the quotation but apparently he found another problem with my car which, if repaired, would cost even more! I am not complaining about the price of repair. What I am more concerned is the attitude and overall service provided, especially Paul Wee or Tony for not console me on the matter.....! I hope the Principal management of PML Spore and Germany would have been more sensitive with the car owner after sales service and not just selling the car....
Frustrated Owner...
They need to improve their workshop, service and attitude.
Hahaha. Carrot nice to eat.
Yes...Paul had a good conversation with me but it's too late...more over he can't help me ...useless ...speechless...helpless...but I still love my car...tks

What Lawrance said is absolutely true.... They r charging way much and service is absolutely lousy.... Munich motors is way much better and since they r here PML has lost their customers for all the right reasons

21.post_text:
Guten Tag! Your shares have unlocked the ultimate destination, Munich. Now be the ONE to win a pair of return air tickets to the heart of Munich and an exclusive BMW Plant Tour. Keep on tagging a friend for more chances to go on this once-in-a-lifetime trip at http://bit.ly/BMW1SeriesShareItFurther. 
Contest runs until 6th September 2015.

To celebrate the launch of the all-new BMW 1 Series, every comment in our “Share it Further” contest helps to bring one lucky winner and a friend to Bali, Hong Kong, Tokyo or Munich with an exclusive BMW Plant Tour. Terms and conditions apply. #L1feworthsharing
